meanings.definition: A room or area below ground level in a building, typically used for storage.
meanings.sent1: The subcellar of the house was dark and cool, perfect for storing old furniture.
meanings.sent2: We found some old books in the subcellar of the library.
meanings.sent3: The subcellar was so full of boxes that it looked like a maze!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a subcellar of forgotten memories, hidden away until now.
meanings.sent5: The subcellar smelled musty, like a forgotten treasure trove waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To place or store something in a subcellar.
meanings.sent1: He decided to subcellar the winter clothes to make more space in the closet.
meanings.sent2: She subcellared the canned goods in the basement for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: I subcellar my secrets in the depths of my mind, never to be revealed.
meanings.sent4: The old memories were subcellared away, waiting to resurface one day.
meanings.sent5: She subcellared her emotions, burying them deep within her heart.
